metadata.title: CVE-2017-5077 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Skia in Google Chrome priorto 59.0.3071.86 for Linux, Windows, and Mac, and 59.0.3071.92 for Android,allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
